intro: Uncinia tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender hookweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or wetlands. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are arranged in compact clusters. Uncinia tenuifolia is primarily valued for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
